snippet: The United States Fish and Wildlife Service has proposed listing a tiny, nearly translucent fish as a threatened species, setting up what is expected to be another bruising environmental battle in the West.   The fish is the delta smelt, which gro...
lead_paragraph: The United States Fish and Wildlife Service has proposed listing a tiny, nearly translucent fish as a threatened species, setting up what is expected to be another bruising environmental battle in the West. The fish is the delta smelt, which grows to a length of only three inches and is found almost exclusively in the Upper Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta east of here, California's largest source of water. Scientists say its population has declined by 90 percent in the last 20 years, from 2.6 million to about 200,000.

headline.main: In California, a Big Battle Is Looming Over a Tiny Fish
